alert.note: Alert for Coastal Gulf (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Rip Current Statement issued December 27 at 11:43AM EST until December 30 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EST /6 PM CST/ THIS EVENING... ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY MORNING THROUGH LATE FRIDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...For the first High Rip Current Risk, dangerous rip currents expected. For the second High Rip Current Risk, dangerous rip currents expected. * WHERE...Walton, Bay, and Gulf County Beaches. * WHEN...For the first High Rip Current Risk, through this evening. For the second High Rip Current Risk, from Thursday morning through late Friday night. * IMPACTS...Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water.
info.instruction: Swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, relax and float. Don`t swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help.
